title: Induced emf - loop with changing area

content.question: A loop with variable radius is in a constant magnetic field. The field is directed perpendicular to the plane of the loop. In Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math> is induced when the radius of the loop increases from <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> to <math alttext="2 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math> during time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></math>. In Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math> is induced when the radius of the loop decreases from <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> to <math alttext="R over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> in the same amount of time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math> to <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1 is greater than the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1 equals the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1 is less than the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></math> cannot be compared to <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math> without knowing the magnitude of the magnetic field.

content.answer: <math alttext="the absolute value of open E sub 1 is greater than the absolute value of open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></math>
